proof:
We can assume that the vertices u, v, and w are distinct, as the inequality holds trivially otherwise. Without loss of generality, let us also assume that $d(v) \ge d(w)$.
We analyze the expression $x_{uv} + x_{uw} - x_{vw}$:
$$
\begin{aligned}
x_{uv} + x_{uw} - x_{vw} & = \left(1 - \frac{|N_H(u) \cap N_H(v)|}{M_{uv}}\right) + \left(1 - \frac{|N_H(u) \cap N_H(w)|}{M_{uw}}\right) - \left(1 - \frac{|N_H(v) \cap N_H(w)|}{d(v)}\right) \\
& = 1 + \frac{|N_H(v) \cap N_H(w)|}{d(v)} - \frac{|N_H(u) \cap N_H(v)|}{M_{uv}} - \frac{|N_H(u) \cap N_H(w)|}{M_{uw}} \\
& \ge 1 + \frac{|N_H(v) \cap N_H(w)|}{M_{uv}} - \frac{|N_H(u) \cap N_H(v)|}{M_{uv}} - \frac{|N_H(u) \cap N_H(w)|}{M_{uw}} \\
& \ge 1 - \frac{|N_H(u) \setminus N_H(w)|}{M_{uv}} - \frac{|N_H(u) \cap N_H(w)|}{M_{uw}} \\
& \ge 1 - \frac{|N_H(u) \setminus N_H(w)| + |N_H(u) \cap N_H(w)|}{d(u)} = 1 - \frac{|N_H(u)|}{d(u)} \ge 0.
\end{aligned}
$$
The first inequality is valid because $d(v) \le M_{uv}$. The second inequality is a consequence of the relation $|N_H(u) \cap N_H(v)| - |N_H(v) \cap N_H(w)| \le |(N_H(u) \cap N_H(v)) \setminus (N_H(v) \cap N_H(w))| = |(N_H(v) \cap (N_H(u) \setminus N_H(w)))| \le |N_H(u) \setminus N_H(w)|$. Finally, the third inequality relies on the facts that $d(u) \le M_{uv}$ and $d(u) \le M_{uw}$.
